Reviews.Title: “very very bad”
Reviews.Author: glorty
Reviews.Content: rooms are dirty, rude staff .I hate it. never gonna back again . its rubbish

Reviews.Title: “!!! Affordable, quiet and guest friendly !!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: I've just come back after a 4-days stay at this hotel, and I am very pleased. Very affordable room tariffs, our room size was good (2 adults and 2 chidlern in a Executive Quad Lux.). Breakfast was continental, simple - but had all you need to start off on a good days sightseeing. Everything was clean, nice and neat. Holland Road can be a bit noisy, seems like a usual route for Emergency Units, so remember your earplugs if you open the windows at night. We were lucky enough to get a room on the garden side, so the noise did not bother us much. Hotel service is good and staff was very friendly and helpful! To all who complain about the room size; (wake up, this is London!), the location, the noise or anything; you always get what you pay for! This is, in my opinion, a very affordable hotel. You get a clean room and bed, breakfast included, few minutes away from many bus stops or the Underground. Also to take into account, is that Holland Park is only a short walk away, with great opportunities and activities for those with younger children. When I go back to London, I will definately concider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and good location”
Reviews.Author: diasryan
Reviews.Content: The room was small but was aliright. Breakfast was continental and good. Very good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet accommodation with good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Skottland
Reviews.Content: A good budget alternative. Helpful and serviceminded staff. Breakfast was OK. Close to the Kensington Olympia station. Good connections(45 minutes) to Gatwick Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and clean, bare bones room”
Reviews.Author: lightwriter
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price, so didn't have high expectations. The front desk staff here could not be more helpful. Their knowledge of the neighborhood and recommendations for local eateries were great. One of our group had a dental emergency, and the staff arranged appointments with an excellent dentist right away. The rooms were clean and the continental breakfast was better than we had expected. While not the hotel's fault, it was hot in London, and the London Visitors Hotel has no A/C. Open windows cooled the rooms at night, but the traffic noise was disturbing at best. The nearest tube station is Kensington (Olympia) Zone 2. If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive hotel in a safe neighborhood, consider this one. Be sure to bring your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Ex-Londoner highly recommends!!”
Reviews.Author: london23087
Reviews.Content: This hotel does NOT deserve the bad reviews, for price location and cleanliness I found it excellent. Having lived in London for years, and around the corner from the hotel for one of these years - this location is fantastic! Travellers to the city might be aware that the term 'hotel' in London can mean anything from a block of flats to a selection of small dirty cupboards serving as rooms- and I have never stayed anywhere in central London so clean. My room was the smallest in the place (they told me so), but quiet, spotless and cleaned daily - FAR superior to other small hotels even on Holland Road ( have stayed at others, as have friends/family so can make comparison) Staff very friendly, very helpful. Did not try their breakfast so can't comment on that the rest is a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “very poor, pretty diabolical for a hotel? in 2009!”
Reviews.Author: Kessymusic
Reviews.Content: Travelled with collegaues and stayed at this location, hotel would be the incorrect description. Whilst I found the staff friendly, my room was depressing, yellow woodchip wallpaper, sheets and blankets, crittal windows with secondary double glazing, it was like stepping back in time, it was all rather horrible really. Breakfast was continental!! the choice was stale white bread with either jam or marmalade, cornflakes, orange juice, stewed tea or coffee which was ok. there was also Mr Kipling Apple Pies for breakfast and lemon cake which I mistook for a bread and put in the toaster, didn't realise until i was offered it one evening with my coffee. Could be a really nice hotel if only they would spend some money on it, excellent location for exhibitions - real shame really but it is their loss at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the Worst Hotel in London??”
Reviews.Author: Fivemiletown
Reviews.Content: A very UNwelcome at reception 3.5 % credit card charge asked for ice - we dont do ice asked for an iron - we dont allow irons room - while clean was a cupboard toilet - have to side sideways as not enough room sink is for a child shower - hot when it got going

Reviews.Title: “The room was the size of a closet!”
Reviews.Author: laurieSanClemente_Ca
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the London Visitors Hotel at the beginning and end of an 11 day trip. Our first room was nice, good sized, clean. Then we travelled. When we returned to London our second room was just a bit bigger than a closet. Two twin beds were stagerred in the room and the you could barely turn around in the bathroom. We paid the same price for both rooms. The breakfast was disappointing, corn flakes, bad scones and hot cross buns. The coffee/tea and OJ were good.

HotelInfo.Name: London Visitors Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 42-44 Holland Road, London W14 8BB, England
